intro: Rudgea cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's rudgea, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, showy white to pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
